data.title: London Symphony Orchestra
data.meta_description: The London Symphony Orchestra inspires hearts and minds through extraordinary music-making – with concerts at home in London at the Barbican Centre and LSO St Luke's, on tour around the world, and online.
data.text:
New Generation Artists: Andrei Ioniță and Alim Beisembayev

BBC Radio 3 Concert

Cellist Andrei Ioniță gives the first of three concerts, joining pianist Alim Beisembayev to perform expressive masterpieces by Debussy and Brahms

New Generation Artists: Andrei Ioniță

BBC Radio 3 Concert

Cellist Andrei Ioniță offers spiritual detox with the solitary beauty and humanity of two of Bach’s beloved cello suites

Season Opening: MacMillan and Sibelius 1

Sir Antonio Pappano

Sir Antonio Pappano opens a new chapter as Chief Conductor of the LSO, conjuring stunning landscapes from Nielsen and Sibelius – and a world premiere by Sir James MacMillan.

New Generation Artists: Aleksey Semenenko, Andrei Ioniță and Alim Beisembayev

BBC Radio 3 Concert

In a concert packed with emotion, Aleksey Semenenko, Andrei Ioniță and Alim Beisembayev breathe new life into treasured Piano Trios by Brahms and Shostakovich.

Elgar and Holst The Planets

Sir Antonio Pappano and Vilde Frang

Two giants of British music, and two blistering orchestral works from the early 20th century. Sir Antonio Pappano begins his first season as Chief Conductor of the LSO, joined by Vilde Frang for Elgar's Violin Concerto.

Rachmaninoff and Saint-Saëns 'Organ' Symphony

Sir Antonio Pappano, Yuja Wang and Anna Lapwood • NB: Change of programme

Berlioz goes to a Roman Carnival, Saint-Saëns gives a Symphony from the organ, and Serge Rachmaninoff shows youthful exuberance in his First Piano Concerto. Sir Antonio Pappano continues his first season as Chief Conductor, joined by Anna Lapwood and Yuja Wang.

Our new Chief Conductor, conjures stunning landscapes from Nielsen and Sibelius – and a world premiere by Sir James MacMillan.

Our Principal Guest Conductor introduces his forthcoming season, with music by Prokofiev, Shostakovich and Brahms
